availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Madison B. Ireland (Henry County, KY, hotelkeeper and farmer.)

body.p: Henry County, Kentucky, hotelkeeper and farmer. Kentucky native. Son of Samuel Ireland. Married to America Hugely Ireland. Father of Cragg M. Ireland, George T. Ireland, Virginia "Jennie" Anna Ireland, Ida Ireland, and Richard "Dixie" Ireland. Resident of Henry County in 1850. Household owned nine enslaved persons in Henry County in 1850. Owned one enslaved person Minerva [Unknown], in Henry County in 1853. Hotelkeeper in Henry County in 1860. Owned two enslaved persons in Henry County in 1860. Farmer in Henry County in 1863.
